references.paper_title: Games with incomplete information played by "Bayesian" players, i-iii part i. the basic model
references.reason: This paper lays the foundational theoretical framework for Bayesian games, a core concept in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Games with incomplete information played by “Bayesian" players part ii. Bayesian equilibrium points
references.reason: This paper further develops the theory of Bayesian games by introducing the concept of Bayesian equilibrium, crucial to the analysis in the current work.

references.paper_title: Autonomous agents modelling other agents: A comprehensive survey and open problems
references.reason: This paper provides a thorough overview of the existing literature on agents modeling other agents, which is directly relevant to the topic of type-based learning in games.

references.paper_title: Belief and truth in hypothesised behaviours
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the challenges of dealing with inaccurate beliefs about other agents' types, a central theme of the current research.

references.paper_title: Bayesian learning in normal form games
references.reason: This paper establishes the theoretical foundation for Bayesian learning in games, which underpins the agent's learning process in the paper.
